description.p: Your patron grants you a crystal infused with their otherworldly energy. You can choose the type of gemstone you recieve. You can use this crystal as a spellcasting focus. Additionally, when you cast a spell using this gemstone as a spellcasting focus, when you roll damage for that spell, you may reroll any die with a result of one. You must use the new roll. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your charisma modifier (minimum one), and regain all uses after completing a long rest. If the gemstone is lost or destroyed, you can perform a ceremony during a long rest to recieve a replacement. The previous stone is destroyed at the end of this ritual.

sheet.description: When you cast a spell using your patron crystal as a spellcasting focus, when you roll damage for that spell, you may reroll any die with a result of one. You must use the new roll.

select.name: Quirk (Pact of the Catalyst)
select.item: You have an obsession with the kind of gemstone your catalyst is made out of.
The longer you go without casting a spell, the more restless you get.
You only show your emotions when you’re using magic.
You bore incredibly easily of mundane and common things.
Losing material wealth physically pains you.
You collect various precious objects in the hopes of impressing your patron.

description.p: Your patron bequeaths an ornate chalice unto you. At the end of each short or long rest you take, the chalice fills with a common liquid of your choice. Examples include holy water, blood, acid, wine, and a single dose of potion of healing. If the chalice is lost or destroyed, you can perform a one hour ritual during a long or short rest to recieve a replacement. If you die or recieve a replacement chalice, the old chalice melts.

sheet.description: At the end of each short or long rest you take, the chalice fills with a common liquid of your choice(for example, holy water, blood, acid, wine, a single dose of potion of healing).

select.name: Quirk (Pact of the Chalice)
select.item: You enjoy bathing in odd liquids, such as blood, wine, or saltwater.
You refuse to drink out of anything other than your chalice.
Minor poisons taste delicious to you.
The air around you always seems to be somewhat humid.
You only sleep well with the sound of running water nearby.
Ale is your best friend.

description.p: Your patron modifies your physical form to be more similar to its own. You gain one of the following permanent physical alterations, and can switch which alteration you have during a short or long rest.

tr.td: Your form becomes tougher, perhaps growing scales, secreting a thin layer of mucus, or being surrounded by protective motes of light. You gain resistance to one damage type, chosen when you gain this alteration.
Your body forms natural weapons, such as fangs, claws, or horns. Your unarmed attacks deal 1d6 bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, depending on the form of the weapon.

Your flesh warps into a swifter configuration, perhaps with legs lengthening, your lower half becoming quadrupedal, or gaining small wings to push your forward. Your movement speed increases by 10 feet.
You gain features that allow you to function in almost any environment. You gain a climbing or swimming speed equal to your movement speed, and can breathe in any environment.
You flesh knits together at incredible speed. At the end of each short or long rest you take, you gain temporary hit points equal to twice your charisma modifier (minimum one).

sheet.description: You gain one physical alteration, and can switch which alteration you have during a short or long rest.

select.name: Quirk (Pact of the Flesh)
select.item: Cooked meat is revolting to you.
People standing near you tend to notice a smell, like seawater or sulphur.
The longer someone looks at you, the more unnerving you seem.
You feel compelled to hide your appearance, even to those you trust most.
If there’s not enough around you to focus on, you can feel something writhing beneath your skin.
You bleed an abnormal color.

description.p: You learn the silent image spell. The spell doesn’t count against your number of spells known.

When you cast the spell, if the illusion takes the form of a humanoid you’re familiar with, you may have the illusion automatically act in the same manner as the humanoid it share’s its appearance with. This acting includes information that you aren’t personally aware of.

sheet.description: When you cast silent illusion, if the illusion takes the form of a humanoid you’re familiar with, you may have the illusion automatically act in the same manner as the humanoid it share’s its appearance with. This acting includes information that you aren’t personally aware of.

select.name: Quirk (Pact of the Mirror)
select.item: You often talk to your reflection as if it could hear you.
You constantly compare yourself to other people.
It upsets you when people don’t notice that you’re clearly the most beautiful person in the room.
You often find yourself subconciously imitating others.
Lying is second nature for you.
An object isn’t clean unless you can see yourself if you look at it.

description.p: You learn the cure wounds spell. The spell doesn’t count against your number of spells known.

Additionally, when you heal someone with your cure wounds spell, you may have the target make a constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failure, the target is infected with your patron’s essence, and is frightened or charmed (your choice) by you for the next 1d4 hours.

sheet.description: When you heal someone with your cure wounds spell, you may have the target make a constitution saving throw (DC {{warlock:spellcasting:dc}}). On a failure, the target is infected with your patron’s essence, and is frightened or charmed (your choice) by you for the next 1d4 hours.

select.name: Quirk (Pact of the Needle)
select.item: The sight of blood comforts you.
You almost always have a cold, but never seem to get seriously ill.
Pain is usually something to be ignored.
Saving a life is the only thing that quenches your guilt.
You act far too calm and carelessly with sharp objects.
Casually making people uncomfortable is one of your favorite pasttimes.

description.p: You learn the sanctuary spell. The spell doesn’t count against your number of spells known.

Additionally, during a short or long rest, you can call on your patron to grant you a gift in the form of a magical inscription. The inscription can be written on anything you can maintain contact with for the hour the ritual takes place. The inscription is clearly visible, and can cast one of your warlock spells as if you had casted it using a warlock spell slot when a trigger condition set during the ritual is met. The inscription disappears after the trigger is met, if another incription is created, or after 24 hours.

sheet.description: During a short or long rest, you can call on your patron to grant you a gift in the form of a magical inscription. The inscription can be written on anything you can maintain contact with for the hour the ritual takes place. The inscription is clearly visible, and can cast one of your warlock spells as if you had casted it using a warlock spell slot when a trigger condition set during the ritual is met. The inscription disappears after the trigger is met, if another incription is created, or after 24 hours.

select.name: Quirk (Pact of the Sigil)
select.item: You compulsively draw your patron’s sigil wherever you can.
Beautiful art is the only thing worth collecting.
You usually write in reverse.
During downtime, you can usually be found engrossed in a book.
Poor handwriting is extremely upsetting to you.
You attempt to teach everyone the languages you know, whether they want to or not.

description.p: Your patron suffuses your very soul with its essence, entwining itself with your very being. As an action, you can unleash this otherwordly essence, increasing your charisma by 5 until the end of your next turn. When you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can unleash the otherwordly essence of your patron, increasing your charisma by 5 until the end of your next turn.

select.name: Quirk (Pact of the Spirit)
select.item: Your speech tends to have an odd lilt to it.
Sometimes, you hear faint whispering that no one else can.
You have nightmares almost every night.
Answers to problems tend to pop right into your head the second they’re posed.
Your eyes change color every so often.
The presence of certain objects fills you with dread.

description.p: Your patron grants you a light source infused with eldritch energy, such as a torch, a candle, a lantern, or a firefly in a jar. When activated, the light source gives bright light out to 30 feet, and dim light to 60. While the light source is shining, you have advantage on perception and investigation rolls made in the lit area, and can see through the light source. If the gift is lost, you can perform a one hour ritual during a long or short rest to recieve a replacement. The light is consumed in flame if you recieve a replacement or die.

sheet.description: When activated, the light source your patron gifted to you gives bright light out to 30 feet, and dim light to 60. While the light source is shining, you have advantage on perception and investigation rolls made in the lit area, and can see through the light source.

select.name: Quirk (Pact of the Torch)
select.item: You tend to ask far, far too many questions.
You are utterly horrified of the dark.
Solving mysteries seems to be the one thing that consistently brings you joy.
Being as vigilant as possible is the only way to stay alive.
You can and do fall asleep in broad daylight.
You are utterly incapable of keeping a secret.

description.p: Prerequisite: Pact of the Catalyst feature
Whenever you use your Pact of the Catalyst feature to reroll a spell’s damage, you may reroll any die with the result 1 or 2 and take the highest result instead.

sheet.description: Whenever you use your Pact of the Catalyst feature to reroll a spell’s damage, you may reroll any die with the result 1 or 2 and take the highest result instead.

description.p: Prerequisite: Pact of the Catalyst feature
When you cast a spell using your catalyst as a spellcasting focus, you may have catalyst be destroyed by the spell’s strength. If you do, you maximize the spell’s damage.

sheet.description: When you cast a spell using your catalyst as a spellcasting focus, you may have catalyst be destroyed by the spell’s strength. If you do, you maximize the spell’s damage.

element.name: Empowered Chalice
element.prerequisite: 8th level, Pact of the Chalice feature

description.p: Prerequisite: 8th level, Pact of the Chalice feature
When you fill your chalice at the end of a rest, the liquid can be an uncommon potion.

sheet.description: When you fill your chalice at the end of a rest, the liquid can be an uncommon potion.

element.name: Eldritch Communion
element.prerequisite: Contact other plane spell, Pact of the Chalice feature

description.p: Prerequisite: Contact other plane spell, Pact of the Chalice feature

During a short or long rest, if you have possesion of your chalice, you may cast contact other plane as a ritual to contact your patron. If you fail the spell’s saving throw, you only take half damage from the backlash.

sheet.description: During a short or long rest, if you have possesion of your chalice, you may cast contact other plane as a ritual to contact your patron. If you fail the spell’s saving throw, you only take half damage from the backlash.

description.p: Prerequisite: Pact of the Flesh feature
You may choose two physical alterations at the end of each short or long rest rather than one.

sheet.description: You may choose two physical alterations at the end of each short or long rest.

element.name: Otherworldly Mending
element.prerequisite: 11th level, Pact of the Flesh feature

description.p: Prerequisite: 11th level, Pact of the Flesh feature
Whenever you use hit dice to recover during a short rest, you may maximize the result.

sheet.description: Whenever you use hit dice to recover during a short rest, you may maximize the result.

element.name: Gift of False Idols
element.prerequisite: 11th level, Pact of the Mirror feature

description.p: Prerequisite: 11th level, Pact of the Mirror feature
You may use your Mystic Arcanum (6th Level) Feature to cast the programmed illusion spell.

sheet.description: You may use your Mystic Arcanum (6th Level) Feature to cast the programmed illusion spell.

description.p: Prerequisite: Pact of the Needle feature
You learn the inflict wounds spell. The spell does not count against your number of spells known.

element.name: Epidemic Needle
element.prerequisite: 18th level, Pact of the Needle feature

description.p: Prerequisite: 18th level, Pact of the Needle feature
Creatures charmed or frightened by you gain the Pact of the Needle feature.

sheet.description: Creatures charmed or frightened by you gain the Pact of the Needle feature.

element.name: Enduring Sigil
element.prerequisite: 11th level, Pact of the Sigil feature

description.p: Prerequisite: 11th level, Pact of the Sigil feature
You may have up to three inscriptions active concurrently.

sheet.description: You may have up to three inscriptions active concurrently.

description.p: Prerequisite: Pact of the Sigil feature
Whenever you create an inscription, you may have it fade from view, requiring an Investigation check equal to your spell save DC to discover it.

sheet.description: Whenever you create an inscription, you may have it fade from view, requiring an Investigation check (DC {{warlock:spellcasting:dc}}).

description.p: Prerequisite: Pact of the Spirit feature
When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can’t use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead.

element.name: Empowered Soul
element.prerequisite: 16th level, Pact of the Spirit feature

description.p: Prerequisite: 16th level, Pact of the Spirit feature
When you use your Pact of the Spirit Feature to increase your charisma, your charisma increases by 10 instead.

sheet.description: When you use your Pact of the Spirit Feature to increase your charisma, your charisma increases by 10.

element.name: Revealing Light
element.prerequisite: 5th level, Pact of the Torch feature

description.p: Prerequisite: 5th level, Pact of the Torch feature
The light from your torch acts as the detect magic spell.

sheet.description: The light from your torch acts as the detect magic spell.

element.name: Searing Torch
element.prerequisite: 5th level, Pact of the Torch feature

description.p: Prerequisite: 5th level, Pact of the Torch feature
You learn the fireball spell. The spell does not count against your number of spells known. Additionally, whenever you cast the spell, you can choose to have the center of the spell be your torch.

sheet.description: Whenever you cast fireball, you can choose to have the center of the spell be your torch.
